abstract.text: Creates and returns an animator object that begins running its animations immediately.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The duration of the animation, in seconds.
The number of seconds to wait before starting the animations. Specify 0 to begin the animations immediately.
The options to apply to the animations. You can specify most options, but transition-related options and options related to the animation direction are ignored. For a list of options, see

The block containing the animations. This block has no return value and takes no parameters. Use this block to modify any animatable properties of your view. Those properties are animated from their current values to the new values using the specified animation parameters.
The block to execute when the animations finish. You can use this block to perform any final actions. This block has no return value and takes the following parameter:
The ending position of the animations. Use this value to determine whether the animations stopped at the beginning, end, or somewhere in the middle.
finalPosition
An initialized animator object or
if the object could not be created.
This method creates the property animator object, configures it, and calls its
method after the specified delay. If you don’t specify an animation curve in the options parameter, this method uses the
option.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
An object that manages the content for a rectangular area on the screen.
Options for animating views using block objects.
Specify an ease-in ease-out curve, which causes the animation to begin slowly, accelerate through the middle of its duration, and then slow again before completing.
Starts the animation from its current position.
Constants indicating positions within the animation.
A class that animates changes to views and allows the dynamic modification of those animations.
Initializes the animator object with a cubic Bézier timing curve.
Initializes the animator with a built-in UIKit timing curve.
Initializes the animator object with spring-based timing information.
Initializes the animator object with a custom timing curve object.
Creates and returns an animator object that begins running its animations immediately.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
The return type of functions that don’t explicitly specify a return type, that is, an empty tuple `()`.

inlineContent.text: The duration of the animation, in seconds.
The number of seconds to wait before starting the animations. Specify 0 to begin the animations immediately.
The options to apply to the animations. You can specify most options, but transition-related options and options related to the animation direction are ignored. For a list of options, see

The block containing the animations. This block has no return value and takes no parameters. Use this block to modify any animatable properties of your view. Those properties are animated from their current values to the new values using the specified animation parameters.
The block to execute when the animations finish. You can use this block to perform any final actions. This block has no return value and takes the following parameter:
The ending position of the animations. Use this value to determine whether the animations stopped at the beginning, end, or somewhere in the middle.
finalPosition
An initialized animator object or
if the object could not be created.
